verses.verse: And when the people<WH5971> complained<WH596>, it displeased<WH7451><WH241> the LORD<WH3068>: and the LORD<WH3068> heard<WH8085> it; and his anger<WH639> was kindled<WH2734>; and the fire<WH784> of the LORD<WH3068> burnt<WH1197> among them, and consumed<WH398> them that were in the uttermost parts<WH7097> of the camp<WH4264>.
And the people<WH5971> cried<WH6817> unto Moses<WH4872>; and when Moses<WH4872> prayed<WH6419> unto the LORD<WH3068>, the fire<WH784> was quenched<WH8257>.
And he called<WH7121> the name<WH8034> of the<WH1931> place<WH4725> Taberah<WH8404>: because the fire<WH784> of the LORD<WH3068> burnt<WH1197> among them.

¶ And the mixt multitude<WH628> that was among<WH7130> them fell a lusting<WH183><WH8378>: and the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> also wept<WH1058> again<WH7725>, and said<WH559>, Who shall give us flesh<WH1320> to eat<WH398>?

We remember<WH2142> the fish<WH1710>, which we did eat<WH398> in Egypt<WH4714> freely<WH2600>; the cucumbers<WH7180>, and the melons<WH20>, and the leeks<WH2682>, and the onions<WH1211>, and the garlick<WH7762>:
But now our soul<WH5315> is dried away<WH3002>: there is nothing at all, beside<WH1115> this manna<WH4478>, before our eyes<WH5869>.
And the manna<WH4478> was as coriander<WH1407> seed<WH2233>, and the colour<WH5869> thereof as the colour<WH5869> of bdellium<WH916>.

And the people<WH5971> went about<WH7751>, and gathered<WH3950> it, and ground<WH2912> it in mills<WH7347>, or beat<WH1743> it in a mortar<WH4085>, and baked<WH1310> it in pans<WH6517>, and made<WH6213> cakes<WH5692> of it: and the taste<WH2940> of it was as the taste<WH2940> of fresh<WH3955> oil<WH8081>.
And when the dew<WH2919> fell<WH3381> upon the camp<WH4264> in the night<WH3915>, the manna<WH4478> fell<WH3381> upon it.

¶ Then Moses<WH4872> heard<WH8085> the people<WH5971> weep<WH1058> throughout their families<WH4940>, every man<WH376> in the door<WH6607> of his tent<WH168>: and the anger<WH639> of the LORD<WH3068> was kindled<WH2734> greatly<WH3966>; Moses<WH4872> also was displeased<WH7489><WH5869>.

And Moses<WH4872> said<WH559> unto the LORD<WH3068>, Wherefore hast thou afflicted<WH7489> thy servant<WH5650>? and wherefore have I not found<WH4672> favour<WH2580> in thy sight<WH5869>, that thou layest<WH7760> the burden<WH4853> of all this people<WH5971> upon me?

Have I conceived<WH2029> all this people<WH5971>? have I begotten<WH3205> them, that thou shouldest say<WH559> unto me, Carry<WH5375> them in thy bosom<WH2436>, as a nursing father<WH539> beareth<WH5375> the sucking child<WH3243>, unto the land<WH127> which thou swarest<WH7650> unto their fathers<WH1>?
Whence<WH370> should I have flesh<WH1320> to give<WH5414> unto all this people<WH5971>? for they weep<WH1058> unto me, saying<WH559>, Give<WH5414> us flesh<WH1320>, that we may eat<WH398>.
I am not able<WH3201> to bear<WH5375> all this people<WH5971> alone<WH905>, because it is too heavy<WH3515> for me.

And if thou deal<WH6213> thus with me, kill<WH2026> me, I pray thee, out of hand<WH2026>, if I have found<WH4672> favour<WH2580> in thy sight<WH5869>; and let me not see<WH7200> my wretchedness<WH7451>.

¶ And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, Gather<WH622> unto me seventy<WH7657> men<WH376> of the elders<WH2205> of Israel<WH3478>, whom thou knowest<WH3045> to be the elders<WH2205> of the people<WH5971>, and officers<WH7860> over them; and bring<WH3947> them unto the tabernacle<WH168> of the congregation<WH4150>, that they may stand<WH3320> there with thee.

And I will come down<WH3381> and talk<WH1696> with thee there: and I will take<WH680> of the spirit<WH7307> which is upon thee, and will put<WH7760> it upon them; and they shall bear<WH5375> the burden<WH4853> of the people<WH5971> with thee, that thou bear<WH5375> it not thyself alone.

And say<WH559> thou unto the people<WH5971>, Sanctify<WH6942> yourselves against to morrow<WH4279>, and ye shall eat<WH398> flesh<WH1320>: for ye have wept<WH1058> in the ears<WH241> of the LORD<WH3068>, saying<WH559>, Who shall give us flesh<WH1320> to eat<WH398>? for it was well<WH2895> with us in Egypt<WH4714>: therefore the LORD<WH3068> will give<WH5414> you flesh<WH1320>, and ye shall eat<WH398>.
Ye shall not eat<WH398> one<WH259> day<WH3117>, nor two days<WH3117>, nor five<WH2568> days<WH3117>, neither ten<WH6235> days<WH3117>, nor twenty<WH6242> days<WH3117>;

But even a whole month<WH2320><WH3117>, until it come out<WH3318> at your nostrils<WH639>, and it be loathsome<WH2214> unto you: because<WH3282> that ye have despised<WH3988> the LORD<WH3068> which is among<WH7130> you, and have wept<WH1058> before<WH6440> him, saying<WH559>, Why came we forth<WH3318> out of Egypt<WH4714>?

And Moses<WH4872> said<WH559>, The people<WH5971>, among<WH7130> whom I am, are six<WH8337> hundred<WH3967> thousand<WH505> footmen<WH7273>; and thou hast said<WH559>, I will give<WH5414> them flesh<WH1320>, that they may eat<WH398> a whole<WH3117> month<WH2320>.

Shall the flocks<WH6629> and the herds<WH1241> be slain<WH7819> for them, to suffice<WH4672> them? or shall all the fish<WH1709> of the sea<WH3220> be gathered together<WH622> for them, to suffice<WH4672> them?

And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, Is the LORD's<WH3068> hand<WH3027> waxed short<WH7114>? thou shalt see<WH7200> now whether my word<WH1697> shall come to pass<WH7136> unto thee or not.

¶ And Moses<WH4872> went out<WH3318>, and told<WH1696> the people<WH5971> the words<WH1697> of the LORD<WH3068>, and gathered<WH622> the seventy<WH7657> men<WH376> of the elders<WH2205> of the people<WH5971>, and set<WH5975> them round about<WH5439> the tabernacle<WH168>.

And the LORD<WH3068> came down<WH3381> in a cloud<WH6051>, and spake<WH1696> unto him, and took<WH680> of the spirit<WH7307> that was upon him, and gave<WH5414> it unto the seventy<WH7657> elders<WH2205><WH376>: and it came to pass, that, when the spirit<WH7307> rested<WH5117> upon them, they prophesied<WH5012>, and did not cease<WH3254>.

But there remained<WH7604> two<WH8147> of the men<WH582> in the camp<WH4264>, the name<WH8034> of the one<WH259> was Eldad<WH419>, and the name<WH8034> of the other<WH8145> Medad<WH4312>: and the spirit<WH7307> rested<WH5117> upon them; and they were of them that were written<WH3789>, but went not out<WH3318> unto the tabernacle<WH168>: and they prophesied<WH5012> in the camp<WH4264>.
And there ran<WH7323> a young man<WH5288>, and told<WH5046> Moses<WH4872>, and said<WH559>, Eldad<WH419> and Medad<WH4312> do prophesy<WH5012> in the camp<WH4264>.

And Joshua<WH3091> the son<WH1121> of Nun<WH5126>, the servant<WH8334> of Moses<WH4872>, one of his young men<WH979>, answered<WH6030> and said<WH559>, My lord<WH113> Moses<WH4872>, forbid<WH3607> them.

And Moses<WH4872> said<WH559> unto him, Enviest<WH7065> thou for my sake? would God that all the<WH5414> LORD's<WH3068> people<WH5971> were prophets<WH5030>, and that the LORD<WH3068> would put<WH5414> his spirit<WH7307> upon them!
And Moses<WH4872> gat<WH622> him into the camp<WH4264>, he and the elders<WH2205> of Israel<WH3478>.

¶ And there went forth<WH5265> a wind<WH7307> from the LORD<WH3068>, and brought<WH1468> quails<WH7958> from the sea<WH3220>, and let them fall<WH5203> by the camp<WH4264>, as it were a day's<WH3117> journey<WH1870> on this side<WH3541>, and as it were a day's<WH3117> journey<WH1870> on the other side<WH3541>, round about<WH5439> the camp<WH4264>, and as it were two cubits<WH520> high upon the face<WH6440> of the earth<WH776>.

And the people<WH5971> stood up<WH6965> all that day<WH3117>, and all that night<WH3915>, and all the next<WH4283> day<WH3117>, and they gathered<WH622> the quails<WH7958>: he that gathered least<WH4591> gathered<WH622> ten<WH6235> homers<WH2563>: and they spread<WH7849> them all abroad<WH7849> for themselves round about<WH5439> the camp<WH4264>.

And while the flesh<WH1320> was yet<WH2962> between their teeth<WH8127>, ere it was chewed<WH3772>, the wrath<WH639> of the LORD<WH3068> was kindled<WH2734> against the people<WH5971>, and the LORD<WH3068> smote<WH5221> the people<WH5971> with a very<WH3966> great<WH7227> plague<WH4347>.
And he called<WH7121> the name<WH8034> of that place<WH4725> Kibroth-hattaavah<WH6914>: because there they buried<WH6912> the people<WH5971> that lusted<WH183>.
And the people<WH5971> journeyed<WH5265> from Kibroth-hattaavah<WH6914> unto Hazeroth<WH2698>; and abode at Hazeroth<WH2698>.
